level.text: Written Request Required. Owners may request a rent increase no later than 90 days prior to any family annual reexamination date. The request must be in writing.

Amount of Rent Adjustment Rent to the Owner may be adjusted either up or down. Subject to compliance with 8304.1 above, the adjusted rent to an Owner who has submitted a written request shall be the LESSER of:
The current rent multiplied by the applicable annual adjustment factor published by HUD as in effect 60 days before the HAP anniversary date; OR
The reasonable rent as most recently determined (or redetermined) by DCHA; OR
The amount requested by the Owner.
Prerequisites to a Rent Increase. The rent may not be increased on the family annual reexamination date unless:
The Owner has requested a specific increase amount at least 90 days before the family annual reexamination date; AND
The request is made in writing on DCHA provided forms for each unit for which an increase is being requested; and
In the preceding year, the Owner has complied with all requirements of the HAP contract, including compliance with the Housing Quality Standards.

Timing of any Increases to Rent. Housing Assistance Payment increases, if approved by DCHA, shall be effective as of the first day of the first month commencing on or after the Participant’s annual reexamination (anniversary) date.
